article.headline: Albany (NY) 76, St. Francis (NY) 64
article.story: NEW YORK -- Gerardo Suero had 25 points to pace four double-figure scorers for Albany (N.Y.), which used a strong run in the final minutes to seal a 76-64 win over St. Francis (N.Y.) on Monday night. Logan Aronhalt added 14 points, Mike Black 11 and Ralph Watts 10 for the Great Danes (6-5), who have won four of their last six games. They also improved to 4-0 against the Terriers all-time. In a back-and-forth game, Travis Nichols knocked down a 3-pointer to put the Terriers ahead 62-60 with 5:16 remaining in the game. But it was all Great Danes from then on, as Suero knocked down a jumper and later converted a three-point play to spark a 16-2 run to the final buzzer. Albany won despite giving away a 41-25 halftime advantage. Nicholas led the Terriers (3-7), who have lost three of four, with 23 points.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
